page.title: 14BULL TESTING STATION 2
page.content: When the bulls arrive they are penned in cribs in{groups of 2 or 3}and weigh {200 to 300 kg. }After 3 months they are{penned individually. }When the testing is over, they weigh between {500 and 700 kg,}depending on their breed. There are{Herefords (English),{Charolais and Limousin (French),{Simontal}(Austrian),{Murray {Greys}(Australian),{Welsh Black (Wales),{Belgian Blue}(South Devon), and{Sussex. Continental breeds}are becoming{more popular}because they {grow quicker}and eventually put on {more weight}than the British breeds. The bulls eat as much as they like - their{food}is in{pellets,}made from a {mixture of dry grass and barley}- and big bulls{eat about 14kg a day. }They are{assessed on}their{weight}after{400 {days. }They are all inspected by a vet,for disease, when they arrive.
